citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There was 1 guinea pig observed with a health condition requiring treatment in accordance with the Program of Veterinary
Care or consultation with the attending veterinarian. A white adult guinea pig in Pen 4 had a head tilt to the right. The
licensee had not observed the health condition and was not administering any treatments.
Head tilts can cause discomfort and can worsen if not treated in a timely manner.
The licensee must communicate with the attending veterinarian to evaluate this animal and determine an appropriate plan
for diagnosis and treatment.

A feral cat was observed in the guinea pig facility and in the pens with the guinea pigs. There was an open window where
the screen had fallen out that appeared to be the point of entry. The licensee replaced the screen but it was very loose
and could easily fall out again.
The presence of other animals in the guinea pig facility can cause distress and feral cats may carry diseases that can lead
to health problems in the guinea pigs.
Housing facilities must structurally sound and maintained in good repair to restrict the entrance of other animals.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There was 1 guinea pig observed with a health condition requiring treatment in accordance with the Program of Veterinary 
Care or consultation with the attending veterinarian. A white adult guinea pig in Pen 4 had a head tilt to the right. The 
licensee had not observed the health condition and was not administering any treatments. 
Head tilts can cause discomfort and can worsen if not treated in a timely manner. 
The licensee must communicate with the attending veterinarian to evaluate this animal and determine an appropriate plan 
for diagnosis and treatment. 
3.25(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
A feral cat was observed in the guinea pig facility and in the pens with the guinea pigs. There was an open window where 
the screen had fallen out that appeared to be the point of entry. The licensee replaced the screen but it was very loose 
and could easily fall out again. 
The presence of other animals in the guinea pig facility can cause distress and feral cats may carry diseases that can lead 
to health problems in the guinea pigs. 
Housing facilities must structurally sound and maintained in good repair to restrict the entrance of other animals. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
